name: Ladybug Scarf
description: The ladybug scarf is worked in rows back and forth with a faux i-cord edge on each side and a rib pattern with faux 1x1 cables. The scarf is long enough to be wrapped around the neck once and tied in the front. It is ideal for beginners wanting to dip their toes into knitting cables and anyone else who wants a small structured piece to spice up their outfits or add a little bit of cosyness.
full_text: The ladybug scarf is worked in rows back and forth with a faux i-cord edge on each side and a rib pattern with faux 1x1 cables. The scarf is long enough to be wrapped around the neck once and tied in the front. It is ideal for beginners wanting to dip their toes into knitting cables and anyone else who wants a small structured piece to spice up their outfits or add a little bit of cosyness. SIZE one size length of finished scarf: 105 cm width of finished scarf: 5,5 cm MATERIALS Lang Yarns Cashmere Premium 6ply 35g (115 m / 25 g) NEEDLES 3 mm circular needle (80 or 100 cm) 2 stitch markers KNITTING TENSION 22 stitches in width and 34 rows in height in stockinette stitch = 10 x 10 cm ABOUT THE PATTERN The pattern has written instructions on how to cast on and how to work the faux i-cord edge. The increases, main part with cable pattern and decreases are charted.
